content.description: Sit start, then climb up and left or straight up or up and right.
content.location:
This has a number of contrivancies on the wall to the left of

Boy Named Sioux

ranging from V0-3.

content.description: Sit start this small, mini-roof/compression problem with heel hooks with your left hand on the left side of the arete and your right hand on a good hold under the roof. Make a few moves and heel hooks, then roll right or left to top out.
content.location: It is on a small overhung block 5 yards west of the Warm-up Wall.

content.description: Sit start using the water grooved funnel with of your both hands, then move slightly right, and use the large flake/sidepull to the top.
content.location:
It is 2 feet or so to the right of the

Middle Line

.

content.description: Crouch start with your hands matched on the small patina, and start traversing to the right. Then you will gain a thin, angled crack with patinas on the lip. Start moving up and right. Move up until you gain the triangle-shaped undercling, then use the sides of the triangle block to gain the top.
content.location: This boulder is west and behind Mano Boulder by 5 yards or so.

content.description:
Do the same start as the

Moccasin Slab Left

, but once you get to the triangle pocket, move right, and match in the pocket. From there, your left hand undercling pinch the top of the triangle pocket, move your feet up until your left foot is smearing in the triangle pocket. Stand up, and use very small sloping crimps then a right foot smear, and then reach for lip.
content.location: It is the right variation on the slab.

content.description: Crouch start with your left hand on a sidepull flake, stand up, and move your right hand to the triangle pocket as a sidepull. Then move your left hand to a small crimp or sidepull, then match your right hand to your left hand. Do a high step, and mantel up, then reach to some small slopers and a good chickenhead. Pull the lip.
content.location: It is 30 yards northwest of the Warm-up Wall.

content.description:
Just to the immediate right of the

Left Line

, sit start on the boulder again. Use great sidepulls and patinas once again.
content.location:
It is a few feet to the right of the

Left Line

.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on a rounded undercling/sidepull, a right hand, half pad undercling, your left foot on a small edge below your left hand, and your right foot out right on a bad chip. Cross your left hand over your body to a rounded, pool ball-sized sloper. Cut your right foot, flag, and reach your right hand over to a good edge. Cut your left foot, catch the swing, bring your right foot over to a small edge, and reach up with your right hand to an angled, protruding, patina edge. Move your left foot up to a small dish on the lip, reach with your left hand, and pinch a thin undercling. From here, twist your body, stand up, bringing the right foot up to the ledge right below your right hand, keep your balance, and stand all the way up. From here, it's a blind reach over your head to a small, 2-3 finger edge with your right hand. Piano match till your left hand is in the good spot and your right hand is free. Walk your feet up a little bit till your right hand can reach a thank God chickenhead...and top out.
content.location:
Once you get to the Main area, looking north,

Boy Named Sioux

will be on your right, and Mano will be on your left.

content.description: Sit start on the boulder, and then climb up the super enjoyable patinas.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Mano

.

content.description: Sit start with your hands on holds under the roof, and move up to a horizontal crack. From here, go straight up using small, amazing, patina crimps and sidepulls.
content.location: It is 5 yards left of the Warm-up Wall.

content.description: Stand start with your right hand on a cigar-sized pinch, your left hand on sloper on the lip about face height, your right foot on a block on the right, and your left foot on a block on the left. Arch your back, and reach your right hand up to a very bad sloper, then move your left hand out to a small sidepull crimp or crimp. Bring your right foot over to match with your left foot. Bring your left foot up to a small edge, and do a dyno right hand to a good angled rail. Match on the rail, and move slightly up and right. Then match your hands in the large, diagonal crack. Stand up, gain the crimp rail, either go straight up from here, or cross your hands, reach out to the arete, and top out the thin arete.
content.location: Once you get to the Main Area, look north with the powerlines, Boy Named Sioux will be on your right and is the first thing to climb.
